She offers her customers fabrics and pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth). She lacks money, which prevents her from having a consistent inventory. This is why she is requesting her 2nd loan from WAGES. In the long run, she would like to be able to open a shop selling pagnes and fabrics. She also hopes to be able to buy some land and to contribute towards the households needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pagnes (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel has always wanted to own a business but wasn’t sure if he had the talent to be successful. As an employee at his friend’s shop, Miguel learned everything he needed to know about tires and became closer to reaching his goal. Working at his friend’s business gave him the confidence he needed to be self-employed. 

G. Tire Shop offers customers tire-changing services, air checks, tire sales and other tire-related maintenance. Miguel says his business differs from other tire shops because he offers faster quality service at better prices.  

After an online search introduced Miguel to Accion Texas Inc., he inquired about the organization and proceeded to apply for a loan. Once approved, he used the loan to purchase a tire changer and an air compression machine, and he become an entrepreneur almost instantaneously. 

Miguel says the Accion loan allowed his business to open sooner. Without it, he says it would have taken almost three months longer to offer his services to the community. But instead, in May 2013, Miguel left his friend’s business to open his own tire shop and is now optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: to purchase a tire changer and an air compression machine.

loans.name: Dieu Merci De Nossin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ANDREA représente le groupe  DIEU MERCI DE NOSSIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 04 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend divers marchandises (l’eau, savon, parfum local, balai etc.) depuis 29ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 et au Mali. Ses clients sont les différents services et un peu partout en ville.
Mme veut s’acheter 02sceaux  de plusieurs catégories de parfum  et 100 balais.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un magasin pour devenir grossiste et s’occuper de sa famille et surtout ses enfants.
texts.en: Andrea represents the Dieu Merci De Nossin group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest is 24 years old and the youngest, 7. All of her children go to school. She has been selling different products (water, soap, local perfume, brooms, etc.) for 29 years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market and from Mali. She would like to buy 2 buckets worth of different types of perfume and 100 brooms. She wants to use her profits to strengthen her business. She aims to open a shop and become a wholesaler, and to take care of her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 buckets of different perfumes and 100 brooms.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Revendeur de téléphones portables, Komla âgé de 30ans est célibataire. C’est en 2009 qu’il exerce cette activité dans une boutique et il s’y plait bien. Il sollicite ce troisième crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et plus tard se marier, fonder une famille.
texts.en: Komla is 30 years old, single and sells mobile phones. He has been doing business in a shop since 2009 and he likes his job. He is requesting his 3rd loan in order to get more merchandise so that he can satisfy his customer demand. He would like to reinvest in his business and to grow it, and later on to get married and start a family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.fr: Tchotchovi est une femme âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée à un chauffeur et elle a un enfant de 09ans scolarisé. Tchotchovi est une revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend pour sa clientèle composée de toutes personnes des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et exerce seule son commerce. Tchotchovi sollicite de WAGES son troisième crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’alimentation générale afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.  Elle espère stocker des marchandises et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Tchotchovi is a 29-year-old woman married to a driver.  She has a 9-year-old chid who goes to school. 

Tchotchovi has been working as a reseller since 2005.  She buys and sells general food products for her customers who come from all walks of life.  She stocks up at the Grand Market in Lomé and runs her business alone.  She is requesting a third loan from WAGES for the purchase of various food products, in order to meet her customers' needs.

She hopes to build up a stock of merchandise and meet her families' needs.

loans.use: to buy various food products.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia immigrated to the United States in late 2009, moving into her son’s home in New Orleans. Having worked all her life in Honduras, she was quick to start her career as a Mary Kay sales consultant in 2010. 

Ofelia applied for her first loan with Accion Texas Inc. in May 2012 and was approved for a $500 credit start loan. Six months later, her credit score increased into almost the mid-600s, when she applied for a second loan. She received her second loan of $2,500 to purchase inventory for the peak season months of November and December. 

In May 2013, Ofelia applied for her third loan with Accion. She requested $7,000, and thanks to the creation of the Latino Emerging Loan Fund, she was able to qualify - with limited collateral - to purchase more inventory. Her goal is to become a Mary Kay sales director and she expects to do so within the next year. 

Mary Kay offers Ofelia the opportunity to advance professionally. But without the Accion loan, purchasing the inventory needed to make sales would have been much more challenging.

A friend who was a previous Accion client told her about the non-profit microlender, so she applied. The Accion lending team helped her understand the application and underwriting process at every turn and she was approved for a loan. “It was great working with Accion,” she says.

Ofelia is a great example of an exemplary Accion borrower. She attends monthly one-on-one sessions with her business adviser, and is currently working to graduate from a hand-written bookkeeping system to an automated Microsoft Excel program.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Through her 30,000-square-foot storage facility, Erika says she “provides a secure, full-service storage operation, for short and long-term storage,” in her hometown of Houston, Texas. The 30-year-old runs her business with one part-time and three full-time employees and plans to hire two full-time employees in the future. 

“Our dry storage space offers high standards of pest control and cleanliness, giving our customers the peace of mind that their product retains its integrity,” she says. “Storing product in our warehouses allows our customers to operate their business in a fast adequate time frame.”

To allow her business to become more efficient, Erika turned to a friend for advice: Accion Texas Inc. was the non-profit microlender recommended to keep the warehouse, Vee Express, operating as projected. The 10-month-old business is growing to the point where Erika ventured to Accion for a loan to fund the purchase of another forklift.

“At Vee Express we specialize in handling and storing plastic polymers and resins of any type…. Storing your product with us not only allows you easy access to one of the biggest ports in the world, but it also allows your product to be stored in an important hub for chemicals or petrochemicals, making your company that much more competitive,” she describes. View her website for more information: www.vee-express.com/.

loans.use: to purchase a forklift.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 40 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Crisanta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, shampoo, and other groceries. 

In the future, Crisanta would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zoenabo

texts.fr:
Etant dans le besoin d’augmenter ses volumes de vente de produits composés de foyers améliorés et à gaz, Zoénabo âgée de 39 ans et résidente au secteur 23 de Ouagadougou désire acheter 9 foyers améliorés et 14 lampes solaires pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. Le montant global du besoin en financement s’élève donc à 211 250 FCFA et Zoenabo, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 vont à l’école ne dispose pas de moyens financiers nécessaires pour acquérir ces produits. Il faut ajouter qu’elle profite d’élargir sa gamme de produits en offrant des lampes solaires dont le besoin existe au niveau de ses clients composés en majorité de femmes dont les revenus sont très faibles.  

En vendant ainsi les foyers améliorés et lampes solaires acquis grâce au prêt, Zoenabo contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses coépouses et celle de sa famille grâce des économies en argent et en temps qu’elles feront. Elle envisage d’ailleurs d’associer la revente de recharge de bouteilles à gaz afin de faciliter l’accès aux recharges par ses clients, d’augmenter davantage ses revenus et de devenir une opératrice économique dans le long terme.
texts.en:
Needing to increase her sales volume of home improvement products and gas products, Zoénabo, aged 39, is a resident of Sector 23 in Ouagadougou, and she would like to purchase 9 home improvement products and 14 solar lamps to satisfy customer needs. The overall amount of her financial need is 211,250 francs CFA.  Zoénabo is a married mother of four children, of whom three go to school. She lacks the funds necessary to acquire these products. It must also be said that she is benefiting from expanding the range of her products by offering solar lamps, which are needed among her customers, mostly women with very low incomes.

Thus, by selling home improvement products and solar lamps acquired with the help of this loan, Zoénabo will help improve living conditions for her co-wives, her family, and herself, thanks to the money and time that will be saved. Beyond this, she envisions including the sale of refilled gas bottles [butane fuel, for example] to facilitate access to refueling for her customers. She also envisions further increasing her revenues and becoming a trader in the long term.

loans.use: to buy and sell 9 home improvement products and 14 solar lamps

loans.name: Sid-Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mr ABDOUL KADER représente le groupe  SID-NOOMA. Il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. L’enfant est âgé de 02ans. Mr a 05personnes en charge.
Mr vend des nattes de paille pour hangar depuis 09ans. Il s’approvisionne à Dori  au Burkina. Ses clients sont les revendeurs et clients ordinaires.
Mr veut s’acheter30 nattes.
Il veut épargner ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne agrandir son d’activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Abdoul Kader represents the Sid-Nooma group. He is married and the father of one child who is 2 years old. He is responsible for 5 people. He has been selling straw mats for hangars for 9 years. He gets his supplies in Dori, in Burkina. His clients are resellers and ordinary retail customers. He would like to buy 30 mats. He wants to save his profits. His aim is to grow his business and to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 30 straw mats.

loans.name: Rockhaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 8 femmes fait parti du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 06/07/2006. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et des villages environnants. Elles pratiquent pour la plupart comme activité le commerce.
Debout à droite et levant la main, Khady est la représentante. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et a la de charge de 11 personnes (ses enfants et ses petits enfants) Elle fait comme activité la transformation d'arachide en huile et de l'embouche ovine.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 50kg d'arachide à 550 le kg pour avoir 22 litres d'huile et le litre est vendu à 1000f. Elle compte acheter aussi 2 moutons pour les élever.
Les bénéfices lui permettront de réinvestir sur l’élevage. Elle va aussi aider son mari handicapé à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of 8 women is part of the "banc villageois" which was formed on the 6th of July, 2006. It is made up of women who live in the same village and neighbouring villages. They are mostly involved in trade.

Khady is the representative and is standing on the right of the picture, raising her hand. She is 53 years old, married and responsible for 11 people (her children and grandchildren). She produces groundnut oil from groundnuts and also practises sheep fattening. She will use the loan she receives to buy 50 kilos of groundnuts at 550 francs per kilo, so that she can make 22 litres of oil, which sells at 1000 francs per litre. She also plans on buying 2 sheep to raise. The profits will enable her to reinvest in her livestock. She will also help her handicapped husband to take care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and 2 sheep.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une femme âgée de 27ans. Elle est mariée à un employé dans une société et a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 08ans et le dernier 05ans. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale (riz, huile végétale, sucre), de mèches, des boissons et autres  produits depuis 2009 à domicile. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté principale est la mévente. Elle est à son second crédit à WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle espère renforcer son activité, agrandir pour en faire une boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akoko is a 27-year-old woman who is married to an employee of a private company. She has two children, both in school. The oldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 5. Akoko has been a retailer of grocery items (rice, vegetable oil, sugar), hair extensions, beverages, and more since 2009 out of her home. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Her main difficulty is a drop in sales. 

She is on her second WAGES loan and is requesting this sum to purchase more merchandise in order to respond better to customer demands. She hopes to bolster her business and expand into a store and to meet the schooling needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy staple foods

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is a 51-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He operates a motorcycle service. He transports customer from one place to another. He has been operating a motorcycle transport service for more than 10 years now.

Benedicto requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy a wheel and and other motorcycle parts so that he can continue to serve his customers and to avoid delay. In the future, Benedicto  hopes that his motorcycle transport service will be successful and his livelihood will be stable.

loans.use: to buy a wheel and and other motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Brittany

texts.en:
A certified care giver with almost two years of experience as an official childcare provider under her belt, Brittany recently went into business operating from her home.

The dedicated sole employee for her business, Brittany began her entrepreneur venture with no financial assistance from family or friends, social media, online ad servers such as Craigslist, or other online assistance. She began only with what she could afford and word of mouth. 

The mother of three, Brittany will begin her business July 1, 2013, thanks to a $5,450 loan from Accion Texas Inc. Without the loan, Brittany wouldn’t have been able to begin her life as an entrepreneur.

Brittany knows there are multiple childcare places in Phenix City, Alabama, and understands she is responsible for the success or failure of her business, but she says the difference between her business and those of her competitors is her unique and substantial customer service offered at competitive prices.

loans.use: to begin her business.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 55-year-old, married mother of seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Flavia has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. Flavia requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell.

Flavia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough to enhance and maintain her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Madeleine Rachel

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme de 35 ans, célibataire et mère de deux (02) enfant. elle a ouvert un mini kiosque où elle vend crédit de communication, friandises etc dans un quartier de la ville qu'elle gère depuis 06 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communications en gros (MTN, ORANGE, CAMTEL) afin d'augmenter son stock de crédit. Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulement pour augmenter son capital et activité et de satisfaire la clientèle. elle voudrait ainsi avec ces derniers pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en: Madeleine is a 35-year-old woman, unmarried, and a mother of two. She opened a mini-kiosk where she sells communication credits [phone minutes], snacks, etc. in a district in the city. She has been running this business for six years. She is requesting this loan to purchase some communication credits in bulk (MTN, ORANGE, CAMTEL) to increase her stock of credit. This will enable her to make a profit not only to increase her capital and her business but to satisfy her customers. Thus, she would like to use this purchase to support herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase communication credits

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes  fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 07/02/2001. Il est composé par des femmes qui habitent le même village et les village environnants. Leurs principales activités restent le commerce et l'embouche. Les femmes sont solidaires et vivent dans une bonne entente.
Khady, assise à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 garçons.Elle fait du commerce. Elle a une échoppe où elle vend des produits de premières nécessités.
Avec le prêt, elle compte renforcer son activités en augmentant ses denrées. Elle va acheter 2 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile de 20l, 1 sac de sucre, 2 cartons de tomate, 1 carton de lait(petit sachet), autres produits divers.
Avec les bénéfices elle rembourse son prêt et avec le reste elle aide son mari dans la tenue du ménage: soin médicaux, nourriture et habillement.
texts.en:
This group of 6 women is part of the "banc villageois" which was formed on the 7th of February, 2001. It is made up of women who live in the same village and neighbouring villages. Their main business activities are trade and livestock fattening. The women stand in solidarity and have good relationships with each other.

Khady, sitting on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of 8 children, 3 of whom are boys. She is a merchant. She owns a stall on which she sells basic supplies. She plans to use this loan to strengthen her business by increasing her stock of food products. She will buy 2 bags of rice, 2 20-litre cans of oil, one bag of sugar, 2 boxes of tomatoes, one carton of milk and various other products. She will use the profits to repay her loans and will use the rest of it to help her husband with the household expenses; healthcare, food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, tomatoes and other food products.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for eight years. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. 

She has been a farmer for five years already and is situated at Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she resides.

She has requested a loan to pay for farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide. In the future, Arlyn hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of  fertilizers.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
Ambrosia is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. 

She engages in farming. She grows rice. She has been farming rice for almost 10 years now. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and additional rice seedlings to increase her harvest. In the future, Ambrosia would like to expand her farming business and make it a stable source of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and additional rice seedlings.

loans.name: Abiratou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales (mais) à Lomé, madame Abiratou est mariée à un conducteur de taxi et mère de 02 enfants âgés de 26 et 23ans. En 2005, elle a démarré la vente des produits céréaliers qu’elle achète à Lomé et dans les villes de l’intérieur du pays. Son second crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère devenir grossiste et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of grains (corn) in Lomé, Ms. Abiratou is married to a taxi driver, and she is a mother of two children, aged 26 and 23. In 2005, she started selling grain products that she purchases in Lomé and from inland cities. Her second loan will enable her to purchase more merchandise. For the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grains (corn).

loans.name: Inyange Group

texts.fr:
Francine fait partie du groupe Inyange et habite à  Ngozi. Elle a  27 ans et est mariée à  Joachin, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants,  âgés de 1 mois  à 12 ans, dont 2 étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  acheter un terrain cultivable, ou une  vache ou une chèvre .
texts.en:
Francine is part of the group Inyange and lives in Ngozi. She is 27 years old and married to Joachin, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 1 month to 12 years old. Two of the children are students. 

Francine has been doing commerce in bananas for eight years. She is on her tenth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a plot of farmland, or a cow, or a goat.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tarakasso, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec Aminata                         debout en premiere position de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna. Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 115.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 37 and, on average, 3 children, who all live in traditional families in Tarakasso, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Aminata, standing on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts and maize. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, herbicide and seeds and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market and surrounding areas to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 115 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her large family with the daily living expenses and to cover her children's healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, vive con su esposo, tiene varios hijos, los cuales algunos de ellos están casados y los otros viven en otro lugar. Ella, se dedica a la ganadería y al cultivo de granos básicos, el oficio lo realiza todos los días junto con su esposo se encargan de cuidar el ganado, asimismo  de comercializar los lácteos que estos produce; también de cultivar la tierra, esto con ayuda de mozos. La ventaja que posee es que el terreno es propio para realizar las actividades agropecuarias. 
El crédito que solicita le permitirá comprar concentrado para el ganado, insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le permitirá tener todo lo necesario para el cultivo y  alimentación para las reces.
Su sueño es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en un futuro dejarle herencia a sus hijos para que no sufran.
texts.en:
Francisca lives with her husband. They have several children, some of whom are married while others live in another area. Francisca works with livestock and cultivates basic grains. She does this work every day with her husband. They care for their livestock and sell the milk that they produce. They also cultivate the land with the help of labourers. They have an advantage in that they own their land.
This loan will allow her to buy feed for the livestock, as well as agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and fungicides. This investment will allow her to have everything necessary for cultivation and for feeding the livestock.
Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life, and to leave an inheritance for her children so that they do not suffer.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock, manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and fungicides, among other items.

loans.name: Mungu Ni Mwema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Solange est conseillère du groupe de crédit « Mungu ni mwema », jeune entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 28 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 50 paires de souliers usés. La crise financière, l’insécurité sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que cette photo fut prise dans un endroit très étroit. Le choix de ce lieu fut motivé pour la sécurisation de clients  et les activités de décaissement.
texts.en:
Solange, the featured borrower, is the representative of the credit group "Mungu ni mwema".  She is a 28-year-old mother of six and a young and courageous entrepreneur.  Her husband is involved in retail and sells various products.  

Solange sells shoes.  She started in this business with some money received from her husband.  She will use this new loan to buy 50 pairs of used shoes.  The financial crisis and a state of insecurity are two major challenges for the development of her activity.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business, send her children to school and build a house.  She thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs through micro-credit.  

It should be noted that this photo was taken in a very tight place, chosen to ensure the safety of the borrowers and to protect payment transactions.

loans.use: to by 50 pairs of used shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita  tiene 55 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Alto San Isidro,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Margarita  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Margarita is 55. She sells basic staples in her corner store, located in the Alto San Isidro zone. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. She will use it for the purchase of merchandise for her business, such as groceries, sweets and pop. There is a lot of demand for her business, which will increase her sales; this is why she is requesting this loan. She needs to stock her business. Margarita faces challenges in her business, namely competition; there are several stores in the area. She will use her profits to buy more stock for her store in order to keep expanding more every day. Her goal for her business is to keep selling and to have a well-stocked store. This way she will be able to expand her business and improve her income with the goal of improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Thérèse est présidente du groupe d’affaire Matumaini,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont seulement un enfant étudie. Son conjoint est un cordonnier. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses produits au marché. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par son mari vers les années. Il ya 35 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 5 sacs de Maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The customer, Thérèse, is the leader of the Matumaini business group. She is an experienced entrepreneur who is 51 years old, married and the mother of 2 children, only one of whom studies. Her spouse is a cobbler. She sells food products and displays her products at the market. She started this business with funds she received from her husband over the years. She has been in this business for 35 years. This new loan will be used to buy 5 bags of maize. She would like to increase her capital, ensure that her children get a good education and buy a plot of land. Finally, she wants to give special thanks to Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of maize.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, asimismo crianza de ganado; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agropecuarios y así logro cultivar los granos basicos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because he needs more working capital for cultivating corn and beans, as well as raising livestock. This will allow him to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, and other items.
His previous loan allowed him to acquire agricultural supplies and thus to cultivate basic grains. His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Please meet 39-year-old Fatu from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Fatu completed Grade 6 and she is married. She describes herself as a hardworking person. Her spouse is not working now. She has four children between the ages of 19 and 3. Two are in school and four of them live at home with her.

Fatu has a table market selling red oil. She has been in business for ten years and works ten hours at her business. With this loan, she will buy more red oil. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by shared bus. She started her business with money from her mother. She is proud of her business because it helps to improves her children. Her plan is to educate her children and own a store one day in the near future. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more red oil.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tarakasso, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  et le maïs avec     Kadiatou   assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,75hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 115.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who are, on average, 37 years old with three children each.  They all live in traditional families in Tarakasso, one of the villages of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans. 

Kadiatou, the featured borrower, grows groundnuts and maize.  In the photo, she is sitting, first from the right.  She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers, herbicide and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing on 0.75 hectare (1.85 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and at the market to a customer base consisting of men and women.  She is expecting to make a profit of 115,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will allow her to repay her loan, help her large family and cover her children's healthcare costs.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Tiaizu

texts.en: Tiaizu is 46 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with seven children between the ages of 28 and 6 years old. Only six of them are attending school and live at home. Tiaizu did not attend school, but she is very good at managing her home affairs and business. For the past three years she has been selling pepper, Vita [a juice drink], rice, etc., in the local market. She works 10 hours at her business in the local market. She started the business with money given to her by her husband. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, Vita, rice, etc., for her business. In the near future, she would like to own a car and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, Vita, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tarakasso, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec  Mafoune debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché . Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi B" are married women averaging 45 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Tarakasso, a village in SIKASSO, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are peanuts and corn, as is the case with Mafoune, who is standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, manure, herbicide, and seeds and to pay for plowing for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the market. She sells to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses, as well as to pay for the children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Les Freres Unis Group

texts.fr:
Mr ADAMA représente le groupe  LES FRERES UNIS. Il est marié et  sans enfant. Mr a 04 personnes en charge.
Mr vend du matériel informatique et des téléphones portables depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne au Nigéria et chez des amis revendeurs en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Mr veut s’acheter 10unités de téléphone portable.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son commerce. Mr ambitionne agrandir son d’activité, la
texts.en:
Mr. ADAMA represents the group LES FRERES UNIS. He is married and without children. He has four persons to support. 

Mr. ADAMA has been selling computer supplies and mobile phones for five years. He gets his supplies from Nigeria and from retailer friends in town. His customers include both men and women. 

He wants to purchase 10 mobile phones and to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tarakasso, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec Mariam                          debout au milieu. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 135.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants
texts.en:
The six members of the group "Benkadi 3" are married women averaging 39 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Tarakasso, a village in SIKASSO, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are peanuts and corn, as is the case with Mariam, who is standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, manure, herbicide, and seeds and to pay for plowing for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the market. She sells to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 135,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her big family to cover day-to-day expenses, as well as to pay for the children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU la troisième personne a partir de la gauche du rang assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group called BENKADI II are married women with an average age of 34 and on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages of Marka Coungo township,  prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, peanuts, millet, okra and sesame. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. 

With this new loan, Oumou, the third person from the left in the row of seated women, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing to maintain around 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. Her produce is sold in the town of Marka Coungo, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 75,000 F CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Santiago Jr

texts.en:
Santiago Jr. is 57 years old and married with three children. He lives in Silanga, Tangub City. Santiago Jr. is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years and every month he earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. He has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires and other accessories.

Santiago Jr. has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Santiago Jr. hopes to to have a reserve fund for the future of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires and other accessories

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Karina se encuentra iniciando su vida crediticia en el grupo de crédito Las Gaviotas al cual fue invitada por su mamá quien forma parte desde hace algunos años, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de una gran vegetación, es muy visitada por sus aguas termales, por su gastronomía y tiene varios lugares para disfrutar con la familia, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Karina tiene 18 años, es soltera y vive con su madre quien se dedica a la atención de un restaurante, la casa en la que viven es propis.

Doña Karina se dedica a ayudar a su madre en la atención del restaurante porque es un negocio familiar desde hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo, también este año va a ingresar a la universidad para estudiar Comercio Exterior. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de la matricula de la Universidad y comprar libros.

Su meta es ser una muy buena profesional.
texts.en:
Señorita Karina is beginning her credit life with the Las Gaviotas credit group, which she was invited to join by her mother, who has been a member for several years. She lives on the outskirts of the town of Baños in Cuenca. This parish is a very green area, and is visited by many tourists thanks to its thermal waters, gastronomy, and range of places for families to visit. Its people have kept local culture and traditions alive.

Karina is 18 years old, single, and lives with her mother, who makes a living working in a restaurant. They own the house in which they live.

Karina helps her mother out in the restaurant because it has been a family business for three years. She works various hours from Monday to Friday, and this year, she is also set to go to university to study Foreign Trade. 

She will invest the loan in paying University registration fees and buying books.

Her aim is to be a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay University registration fees and buy books.

loans.name: Sen-Ka-Seebo Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIZETA représente le groupe SEN-KA-SEEBO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des céréales depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Léo et à Bobo. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter  15sacs de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  mieux scolariser son enfant.
texts.en:
Mme ALIZETA represents this group called SEN-KA-SEEBO. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 26 and the youngest nine years old. One of them goes to school. She is responsible for four people. 

Mme Alizeta has been selling cereals for seven years. She buys her produce at Leo and Bobo. Her customers are men and women. 

She wants to buy 15 sacks of maize. With her profit, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to offer her child better schooling.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beans and corn for her restaurant

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:

Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU la première personne a partir de la droite du rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group called BENKADI III are married women with an average age of 38 and on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages of the township of Marka Coungo,  prefecture of Dioîla, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. 

With this new loan, Kadiatou, the first person from the right, standing, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and to pay for plowing for about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

The produce is sold in the town of Marka Coungo, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Kadiatou expects to make an average profit of about 75,000 F CFA per planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Laura Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Laura  forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Gaviotas, este su cuarto crédito que realiza en conjunto con sus amigas y vecinas del sector. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de una gran vegetación, es muy visitada por sus aguas termales, por su gastronomía y tiene varios lugares para disfrutar con la familia, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Laura tiene 27 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 11,7 y 3 años  y un bebé de 4 meses, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Laura aprendió desde muy joven el arte de la sastrería, labora en el taller que tiene en su casa de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. Para tener un ingreso extra también cría y vende de pollos. Por el momento le va muy bien en estas dos actividades. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de la entrada de una máquina de coser que esta por adquirir. 

Como le gusta la estética su sueño es estudiar y llegar a tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the loan group Las Gaviotas [The Seagulls].  This is her fourth loan that she is making together with her friends and neighbors.  She lives in the outskirts of the Baños parish in Cuenca.  This parish enjoys great vegetation and is well-visited due to its thermal baths, gastronomy, and many places to enjoy with the family.  The people still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Laura is twenty-seven years old and is a single mother of four children, ages 11, 7, 3, and 4 months.  Her first two children are studying in a small school in town.  They own the house that they live in.

Laura learned the art of tailoring when she was very young.  She works in a tailor's shop that she has in her home from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.  In order to earn extra income, she also raises and sells chickens.  For the moment, she is doing very well in both of these activities.

She will invest the loan money in the down payment of a sewing machine that she is in the process of acquiring.  

Because she likes aesthetics, her dream is to study and be able to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to cover the down payment on a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres de l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NAMISSA  première personne à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5.Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, and sesame. They are on their sixth collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, NAMISSA, who is the first person sitting from the right, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding.
