In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where maize is grown. They sell the harvested maize and wine locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for the family's food expenses. According to Credo estimations, his family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 
Imeda has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Imeda has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Imeda will begin trading with fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables, which will be transported by his minibus for resale at higher prices. This will help to increase the income of his family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Imeda's family.

loans.use: to begin trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla is a 45-years-old married woman, who used her previous loan to buy more flour as well as some other ingredients and tools for making her special bread “Shrak”. Layla couldn’t buy a flour mixer at that time, so she is now applying for another loan to get the flour mixer she wants that will make her work easier.

loans.use: to buy a flour mixer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, a 49-years-old woman and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Redentor, a vendor and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. They both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day. She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 
All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is divorced and blessed with three children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She cooks food for sale at the market, and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites theft as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, Cecilia wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 40 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Emelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. Emelita has been raising livestock for the past 5 years, and also earns additional income from a general store and motorcycle transport business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Belal

texts.en: Belal, a 35-years-old married man and a father of three children. His wife currently works in the Ministry of Health when he decided to open his own business. Belal started his business by renting a small store and then turned it into a mini market to sell some basic food products and goods to the neighborhood. Now Belal has expanded by renting the store next door. Now he is seeking a loan to increase the quantity of goods he has to market as well as to add some variety in what he sells to satisfy all tastes of his customers.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods he has to market

loans.name: Ghazal

texts.en: Ghazal is 24-years-old hard working woman of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. Ghazal is very experienced and skilled woman. She has been selling bed sheets and cloth for the past 2 years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase new varieties of bed sheets and cloths from other cities at lower rates and then sell it here for profit. She is living in a rented house and she wants to build her own house. This loan could help her to fulfill her dreams and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon is a 40-years-old married woman. She has three daughters and one son. Maysoon’s husband works in glass making and shaping. On the other hand, Maysoon does embroidery artwork and sometimes glass paintings. Now Maysoon is applying for a loan to get more fabric for her embroidery business as well as more colorful threads to make some fabric frames for her glass paintings.

loans.use: to get more fabric for her embroidery business as well as more colorful threads to make some fabric frames for her glass paintings.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 27 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Rowena has been raising pigs for the past 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 53 years old and married with five children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store, like cream, coffee, noodles, laundry soap, bath soap and other groceries.

Lucena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lucena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store, like cream, coffee, noodles, laundry soap, bath soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 53-year-old widow. She lives with her two sons and helps them by working at her mini-market, selling basic food products and a few types of detergents. Now Maryam is seeking a loan to increase the quantity and variety she has of goods in the store.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and variety she has of goods in the store.

loans.name: Najjera Twezimbe Women's Group

texts.en:
Sylivia is a single mother of two children and runs a restaurant in a rural area. Both children attend a nearby school. She joined the business two years back so that she could be able to provide for her children all the basic needs, including education.

Through the group, she was able to get a loan even without collateral, which was her major hindrance. She therefore thanks the group members for standing with her in helping her grow her business. She wants the loan to pay for a stall in a busy place such that she can get more customers and therefore increase her income. She is a hardworking young woman.

loans.use: To pay for a stall in which she will run her restaurant.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
64-year-old retired Zurab lives in a small village of the Zestaponi district, Zvare with his retired wife. Zurab requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The family's only source of income is their own pensions, which in total is 195 Lari per month. This amount is rarely enough for the family's food expenses. 
Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Zurab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Zurab will purchase a car to drive it as a taxi. Zurab wants to increase the family income and for this, he will drive locals around to earn a small daily income. The profit will be used for covering the food expenses and for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car and drive it as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more stock of pizza as needed in her business.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: Abdulrahman is a 36-years-old married man. He is a father of one son. Abdulrahman is the only working person in his family. He started a small business by opening a mini market and sell a few types of food ingredients and cans. Now he wants to improve his business by adding more types of food products for sale. For this, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more types of food products for sale

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 31 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District with his wife, brother and pensioner parents. Gocha has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the family's income is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow tomatoes, watermelons and eggplants. They sell the harvested products at local markets. Besides this, Gocha has a tractor which is rented out seasonally. It is hardly enough for the family's food expenses. According to Credo estimations, his family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 
Gocha has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Gocha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Gocha will purchase a minibus. After the minibus is purchased, he will be able to begin trading with fruits and vegetables. This will help increase the income of their family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Gocha's family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gulfam

texts.en: Gulfam is a 54-years-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and their 6 children. Her husband has been running a tire shop for the past 15 years. Gulfam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will purchase new tires for sale, and this would increase his net income and savings. Gulfam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 29 años es una mujer activa y creativa, esta casada con el padre de sus 02 hijos de 13 y 07 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven juntos en su casa propia.
Vilma se dedica a la venta de residuos de madera los cuales compra en grandes cantidades para luego distribuirlos entre los agricultores; este trabajo lo realiza en su casa ya que coloca los residuos de madea en costales de plástico para luego repartirlos ,lleva más de 05 años en esta actividad la cual lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo . Al principio le fue un poco complicado empezar ya que no tenia nada de conocimiento para este negocio, pero con el tiempo aprendió bastante y ahora tiene las pautas necesarias para poder tener contentos a sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar el tiempo para realizar otras actividades, además cuando tiene un tiempo libre se va al mercado a vender algunos productos, sobre todo sabanas y colchas, tiene muchos clientes y esto le genera muy buenas ganancias. Este será su primer crédito con Kiva y esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para realizar este negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará residuos de madera al por mayor.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and an active and creative woman.  She is married to the father of her two children, who are aged thirteen and seven years old each.  The family lives together in their privately owned home.

Vilma makes a living selling wood chips that she buys in bulk in order to sell to farmers.  She does this work from home as she stores the wood chips in large plastic bags.  Vilma has been doing this work for over five years and receives help from her husband.  In the beginning, this work was complicated as Vilma did not know anything about this kind of business but, with time, she has learned a lot and now has the necessary knowledge to keep her customers happy.  What Vilma likes about her work is that she can use her time to do other things as well.  In addition, when she has free time, Vilma goes to the market to sell other products, particularly bed sheets and bedspreads. She has many customers and this work generates a lot of profit.  This will be Vilma's first Kiva loan and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support to do this work.  Vilma will buy wood chips in bulk with this loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles.

loans.use: to buy wood chips in bulk.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 34 años de edad, esta casado con Yudy, quien es empleada y madre de su único hijo de 03 años , juntos viven en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Oscar es la construcción de viviendas por zona, pero como es muy  conocido a veces es solicitado en ciudades aledañas. Se inició hace más de 10 años, por iniciativa propia, ya que contaba con conocimientos necesarios para iniciarse en está actividad y necesitaba contar con sus propios ingresos para así no depender únicamente de una empresa. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, está ahorrando sus ganancias pues desea en un futuro abrir una bodega de abarrotes para dar una mejor calidad  de vida a  sus hijos. Por tanto éste será su primer préstamo con Kiva y está agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles, comprará herramientas de construcción como martillos, combas, winchas, clavos , entre otros.
texts.en: Oscar is 34 years old and married to Yudy, who has a job and is mother to their only son, who is three years old.  This family lives together in their own privately owned house.  Oscar makes a living building homes in the local area.  However, because he is very well-known, sometimes people ask him to work in neighbouring cities.  Oscar started this business with his own initiative over ten years ago, as he already had the necessary knowledge to do it.  He needed also to be able to have his own income so that he did not have to rely solely on another business.  So, seeing his good results, Oscar is saving his profits as, in the future, he would like to open a grocery store so as to provide his children with a better quality of living.  This will be Oscar's first loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support that he is receiving in order to get ahead.  Oscar will buy building tools such as hammers, measuring tapes, sledgehammers and more with this loan of 4000 Nuevo Soles.

loans.use: to buy building tools such as hammers, measuring tapes, sledgehammers and more.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.es:
La señora Tereza de estado civil unida de hecho, de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos y los dos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de pollos para criarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro desea tener una granja grande con varios animales para poder venderlos en el mercado y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y elaboracion de guipiles tipicos.
texts.en:
Tereza, 54, has a common-law husband and two children in school, although she was unable to get an education herself.  She has a business raising chickens that she began with a small amount of money that she received from her husband.  So far, she has been in business for ten years.

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan to buy chickens to raise and sell.  In the future she would like to have a large farm with many animals to sell at the market and increase her income.  

The other members of the group are involved in sales, livestock farming and traditional costume making.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: La Laguneta Group

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso su estado civil es unido de hecho, de edad 35 años, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, él se dedica a la agricultura cultiva Café, inició este negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenia y compro unas plantitas de café y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante para su cultivo de café y en el futuro desea tener una plantación más grande de café y tener abundantes cosechas; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a agricultura siembran maíz, café y frijol.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 35, has a common-law wife and three children, one of which is in school; and he himself has a third grade education.  Alfonso grows coffee for a living and began his business with a small amount of savings that he used to buy a few coffee plants.  He has ten years' experience to date.

He decided to organize a group and request a loan to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.  In the future he would like to have a larger coffee plantation and abundant harvests.  The other members of the group are farmers who grow corn, coffee and beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 27-year-old man from Obunga in the city of Kisumu; he is married to Salome, who is also a business woman and supports the family. He supports two people in his family; he has one child who is five years old.

He makes fertilizers for small scale farmers; it is a business that he has been doing for the last six years. Erick makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more raw materials for making fertilizers. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has hopes of expanding his business and to be in a position to support his family.

loans.use: To add more stock of molasses.

loans.name: Terminal Vii Group

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Esther es soltera, de edad 23 años, curso los 6 años de educación secundaria, ella tiene un comedor, inició este negocio con su padre y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Decide organizar un grupo y asi poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos tales como: azucar, café, granos basicos, entre otros, en el futuro desea contar con un capital mayor y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a vender comida, venta de ropa y tieneda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Blanca Esther, 23, is single and has a sixth grade education.  She runs a diner that she started with her father four years ago and operates with the support of her family.

She decided to organize a group in order to request a loan to buy supplies such as sugar, coffee, basic staples, etc.  In the future she hopes to have more capital so she can continuing satisfying her customers' needs.  The other members of the group sell food, clothing and run a convenience store.

loans.use: To buy diner supplies.

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es: La Sra. Danitza tiene 30 años, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 11, 7 y 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la populosa feria de la  16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Danitza va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la  Sra. Danitza enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la  Sra. Danitza es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Danitza, 30, is married and has three children, ages 11, 7 and 3.  She has a used clothing stall at the busy "16 de Julio" Market in the city of el Alto.  This loan is her first through the institution and Danitza plans to use it to buy bulk used clothing for her business.  She is requesting the loan due to her lack of capital.  Danitza has a lot of competition in the area because many people are in the same business.

She will use the profits she earns to continue fixing up her stall.  She eventually wants to have a wide variety of stock to offer her customers.  Danitza is a very hard worker and is happy and grateful to the institution for this support which will allow her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy bulk clothing.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en: Sameh is 22 years old, and a resident of Taiz, Yemen. He mentions that he has been involved in selling cosmetics and perfumes for five years. His parents taught him how to develop in this business. There is a lot of activity in his area, as far as all types of arts and crafts are concerned. Because of his good customer skills, he is able to attract more clients. He would like to expand his business. So, he took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER to stock his business with cosmetics, ladies' handbags and perfumes. He wishes to open additional business in same field.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, ladies' handbags, and perfumes for his business.

loans.name: Monica Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 23 años,  casada con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de una  año,  la Sra. Mónica se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de higiene y limpieza como champó jabón, jaboncillos, peines y toallas y variedad de artículos en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en una de las zonas más concurridas  de la ciudad de El Alto, ella es cliente que se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de artículos de limpieza para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Mónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mónica, 23, is married and has a one-year-old child.  She sells personal care and cleaning products, such as shampoo, soap, combs, towels and a variety of items at the stall she has in one of the busiest areas of the city of El Alto.  This is her first loan through the institution and she plans to use it to buy a variety of cleaning products to stock her business.  This will allow her to offer her customers a wider range of products.

Mónica has requested the loan so she can continue improving her business.  She will use the profits to continue buying products and improving her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cleaning products.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a 52-year-old gentleman. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 24 and 13 years. He has been operating a hardware shop for the last three years and has a monthly income of KES 45,000.

Jason got to learn about KADET LTD from his wife's colleague, who is a registered member. He has acquired a fourth loan of KES 35,000, which will facilitate him in hiring staff to manage the hardware business as he focuses on opening another branch.

Proceeds from the business will be plowed back into it for expansion. His dream is to expand the business into a large venture that serves the entire county.

loans.use: to employ extra staff in his hardware business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: While her husband works as a carpenter, Edna is very happy managing her hog-raising business. Aside from that, Edna sometimes cooks food and sells it in their village as an extra source of income. The couple already has a child whom they really love. According to them, they are working double time to provide for the needs of their child. Edna desires to generate more income; thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She believes that with sufficient feed, her hogs will grow healthy, which will result in a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one daughter. She has been doing the business of selling school bags for the past 13 years. Her sales are increasing with time. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to purchase a new variety of school bags so that her sales and net income will increase. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC. Kalsoom is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase school bags for her retail business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers. Teresita has been in this business for five years. Teresita earns more income from her motorcycle transport business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is forty years old and married to John. She is the mother of three children. She rears chickens and she has been in the business for the last five years; she makes a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She learned about LTD from some women in the market. She has been issued a second loan of KES 40,000 after successfully repaying her previous loan. The funds will be used to purchase poultry feed as well as buy additional chicks. The proceeds will facilitate the expansion of the chicken house.

Virginia hopes to generate enough income to establish a hair saloon.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and buy more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en: Samreen is a 30-year-old woman. Her husband is running a business of selling gem stones for the past 10 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Samreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would increase. After getting the profit, Samreen would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: to buy rare gem stones to sell.

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 27 años de edad con un grado de educación cursado hasta sexto de primaria que en compañía de su esposo trabajan la agricultura en lo que el cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Ellos tienen 4 hijos dos están en la escuela, uno en el kínder y último aún está bien pequeño. Ella se dedica a la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo de café hace más de 8 años actividad aprendida de su padres que han sido agricultores toda la vida y sus actividades económicas son el cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Las tierras que ella en compañía de su pareja cultiva las han adquirido gracias al esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación para tener lo propio las cuales están ubicadas a una distancia de un kilómetro a la cual se trasladan a pie.

María actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante, abono entro otros insumos para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café los cuales son su único medio de ingreso familiar.

Sus planes a futuro es comprar más parcelas de tierra para seguir cultivando y su sueño como madre es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida y que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar para que el día de mañana sean mejores.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and completed up to the end of sixth grade at primary school.  María works in farming, growing beans and corn, alongside her husband.  The couple has four children, two of whom are in school; one is at nursery and the youngest is not yet old enough for school.  María has been working in farming and growing coffee for over eight years.  She learned this trade from her parents, who were farmers all their lives.  They earned a living growing corn and beans.  María bought her land after a lot of effort, hard work and dedication.  The plot is a kilometre from the family home and María and her husband arrive there by foot.  

María is currently applying for a loan in order to buy fertiliser, manure and other supplies to maintain her coffee plants, which are her only source of income to support the family.

María's future plan is to buy more plots of land so as to continue to grow crops.  As a mother, her dream is to see her children have better living conditions and for the them to have more opportunities so that, later, they can be better off.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le arachide  avec NYELE , 2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 20.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djantoyerela III group are married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba (in the 2rd administrative region of Mali). 

The members of the group collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution.

Nyele, pictured standing second from the left, grows groundnuts. She will use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay the labour costs to maintain 0.5 hectares. 

After harvest, she sells her produce in the village, at the market, to both consumers and traders. 

She is hoping to make 20 000 CFA francs per campaign and this money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Cyrille Epiphanie

texts.fr: Cyrille est  une jeune femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 2 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Cyrille is a young woman, 38 years old, married, and the mother of four. After completing her training, she opened a small sewing workshop, which has been doing well for two years already. She also does embroidery but does not have all the equipment and supplies to complete her special orders on time to satisfy her customers. To do so, she is requesting a loan to purchase some cloth and sundry sewing supplies (pins, needles, linings, thread, …) that will keep her from having to go to the market all the time. She will be able to sew clothing and sell them to her customers. The profit derived from this loan will enable her not only to purchase her sewing supplies but also to expand her business and satisfy certain needs of hers, as well as those of her small family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing necessities

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  KADIATOU , 3 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 15.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djantoyerela IV group are married women. On average, they are 35 years old and have six children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba (in the 2rd administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Kadiatou, pictured standing third from the left, grows millet. She will use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay the labour costs to maintain 0.5 hectares. 

After harvest, she sells the produce in the village, at the market, to both consumers and traders. 

She is hoping to make 15 000 CFA francs per campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Djantoyerela V Group

texts.fr:
Les  5 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  SEBA , 3 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Djantoyerela V group are married women. On average, they are 35 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba (in the 2rd administrative region of Mali). 

The group members collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution.

Seba, pictured standing third from the left, grows rice. She will use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay the labour costs to maintain 1.5 hectares. 

After harvest, Seba sells her produce in the village, at the market, to both consumers and traders. She is hoping to make 85 000 CFA francs by the end of the campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Lesinko

texts.en:
Lesinko is 61 years old and married to Nalamae. He is a father to seven children between the ages of 19 and 29 years. For the last 10 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in this area due to good climate conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be his second loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his goals.

loans.use: to prepare the land for the planting season.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is still single, but he works hard because of his passion to succeed and help his parents. Edward manages a bakery business in their village. He hired two boys as his helpers in baking bread. Edward goes to the market early in the morning to buy raw materials to bake different kinds breads. In the evening, he and his helpers start to bake and deliver their bread to his costumers in different villages.

Edward admits that he is tired after his daily routine, but he still continues to work because he wants to make his dreams a reality. With regards to his business, Edward is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy flour, sugar and other raw materials used in baking breads. Edward hopes that KIVA lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other raw materials for baking bread.

loans.name: Cica Nina Rachelle's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Cica Nina Rachelle (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans. Cica Nina Rachelle est mariée à un certain Ludovic. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cica Nina Rachelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de ménage. Cica Nina Rachelle n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Cica Nina Rachelle vend également des fournitures de couture dans son atelier depuis une quinzaine d'années. Cica Nina Rachelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit,Cica Nina Rachelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe,un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This is a group which consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, named Cica Nina Rachelle, is 39 years old.  She is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Cica Nina Rachelle is married to a man named Ludovic.  They have two children together, who both go to school and are their dependents.  Cica Nina Rachelle lives with her husband and children and jointly takes care of the household expenses with her husband.

Cica Nina Rachelle did not attend school but she has learned sewing.  In order to better meet her family's needs, she has also been selling sewing supplies, in her shop, for the past fifteen years.  She buys her goods at a market located in Benin.

In order to meet the demand of an increasing group of customers, and also to make more profit, Cica Nina Rachelle is requesting a second loan from  ALIDé, along with the other members of the group.  Their previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Emilenne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Émilienne(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)est âgée de 58 ans. Émilienne n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Émilienne est mariée à un certain Désiré. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Émilienne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Émilienne et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Émilienne vend des vivres(maïs)par la méthode de distribution depuis environ une année. Émilienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Émilienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group consists of four women who live in the same house. The group's representative, named Émilienne, is 58 years old. She is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Émilienne did not attend school.  She is married to a man named Désiré with whom she has four children.  All their children are in school and two are their dependents. Émilienne lives with her husband and her children and jointly takes care of the household expenses with her husband.

In order to contribute to the family's expenses, Émilienne has been selling food supplies (maize) through the distribution system, for about a year.  She buys her goods at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting  a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the group.  Their previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy food supplies (maize).

loans.name: Kotognongontala  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Kotognongontala 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Fachoribougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème   région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Dixièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : la tomate, piment  et l’aubergine  avec    Naminata  debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognongontala 1 group are all married women. They have an average age of 39 years, and have an average of four children each. They all live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their businesses during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and have repaid all their prior loans without incident.
 
The women in the group grow tomatoes, peppers and eggplant. Naminata is a member, and is pictured standing in the center of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers, herbicides and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor expenses involved in farming her one hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her produce in a village market in Sikasso and the surrounding areas, and her customers are both male and female. 

Naminata expects to make a profit of 100,000 francs CFA each season. These profits will allow her to make repayments on her loan, as well as to help her large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor expenses and hoeing.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en: Edralyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional firewood to sell. Edralyn has been in this business for two years now. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Edralyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Elder

texts.en:
Elder is a 26-year-old lady from Katuo in Nyalenda, which is located in the city of Kisumu. She supports three people in her family; she is married to  Reuben who is also a business man and supports the family. They have three children who are nine, seven, and five years old.

She sells fruits and vegetables; it is a business that she has been doing for the last three years. It generates a monthly income of KES 15,000; she is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale, and she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and become stable so as to provide income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This marks Mariam's third time borrowing to renovate her food kiosk, and to pay school fees for her high school daughter. 

Her business is doing great and she has been servicing her loans well. 

She hopes to improve the seating capacity in her kiosk in the future, so she can have additional income to support her children without strain.

loans.use: to renovate her food kiosk and pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
This is Jerry. His previous loan was a big support to his business and also helped with his household's expenses, especially with his children's education. He has been in this business for sixteen years now, and he and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Jerry would like to apply for another 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund that he uses to buy scrap materials. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jerry dreams that his business will continue to be successful. He meets up with his fellowship co-members to share stories of his work every week, and he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials for recycling.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 57 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Alma has been raising pigs for 35 years and also earns additional income from her general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Leonita is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store.

Leonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en: Over several years of hard work, Artashes owns a beautiful farm near a small town of Spitak, which is in Vanadzor area. He is engaged in swine breeding and he keeps his farm animals in the barn located near the city. Artashes has three workers who help him around the farm. He also sells pigs and meat to meat production centers and to his loyal customers over the city. Artashes has higher education; he has graduated Yerevan State Agricultural Institute the Department of Veterinary. For many years, he has worked in his specialty. Artashes lives with his wife and two children who are already students. Artashes has decided to buy eighty-six piglets and a lot of fodder; he needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams. He has great plans connected with his farm and he hopes that this deal with Kiva will be a kind of stimuli for future cooperation.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn. She previously accessed a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 25,000 loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jonalyn dreams that her food stall will be a restaurant and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josette

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Josette works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Josette is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business. Josette has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arbnor

texts.en:
Arbnor is 20 years old, recently married, and has a child who is one years old. 

In order to earn a living, he works at a private company as a construction worker, but with a very low salary. His wife isn't working at the moment; she is staying at home to care for their child and the home.  Arbnor had wanted to do some general renovations to his home, but he is unable to do so with the low amount of money that he earns from his work. 

Now for the first time, he is asking for a loan to redo the flooring in the apartment and make some other general renovations. The loan will help them to have a pleasant atmosphere and good living conditions.

Arbnor is hoping in the future to buy a piece of land and to build a house. His goal is to improve the living conditions, and to have another baby. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate his apartment.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy ingredients for banana cue and kamote cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines, made of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. Kamote cue is made from sweet potatoes. It is coated with brown sugar and then fried to cook the potatoes and caramelize the sugar. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and is sold on the streets. 

Her earnings were a big help in her personal and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to purchase bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil, and gas needed for her banana cue and kamote cue business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil, and gas needed for her business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 59 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Guillerma is in the agricultural business; she buys and sells livestock in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for her business.

Guillerma has been buying and selling livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 47-year-old husband and father of two who lives in Utsera village in the Oni district of Georgia. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His applications were rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is agricultural activities. They own a plot of land, where they grow potatoes and walnuts to sell at local markets. Their total income is so small that it is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Zaza has requested a loan from Credo to start a new family business and has now been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with manageable conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers”. With his credit, Zaza plans to buy a milk cow that the family will milk every day and start producing dairy products. These will be sold to fellow villagers and at local markets, together with their other produce. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly increase the family income and Zaza will be able to improve their living conditions and ensure a better life for them.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
This is Conchita. She previously accessed a PHP 13,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Conchita dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to help her grandchildren in their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ngirimba

texts.en:
Ngirimba, 48, is an industrious married gentleman who supports a family of ten. He is a farmer who grows various crops, includes potatoes, wheat and barley, for commercial use. He has been in the farming business for the last twenty years, making a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Ngirimba first learnt about KADET LTD from other farmers in the area and he has been advanced his eighth loan of 90,000 KES to hire a tractor to cultivate his land, and to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

He will use the proceeds from the loan to put up a water tank in order to harvest water, a scarce commodity in the area, during the rainy season. His dream is to see the living standards of his family improve.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for cultivation and to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from frozen foods. Johna is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abdukudus

texts.ru:
Абдукудус мужчина 49 лет.  Пунктуальный и очень активный человек.  Женат и имеет четверых детей. Старшие сыновья помогает ему в бизнесе.  А жена работает дома, воспитывает младших детей.  У них большая и счастливая семья.  Раньше они жили в кишлаке, но когда дети повзрослели они купили дом в городе и переселились в город. В городе Абдукудас начал свой бизнес.  У него небольшой ларек на местном рынке. Он торгует продуктами питания( конфеты,печенье,сладости).  Этот вид деятельности ему очень нравиться потому что от этого Абдукудус получает хороший доход. 
На данный момент он хочет расширить свой бизнес и закупить ассортимент разных сладостей.  Абдукудус решил подать заявку на кредит и обратился в организацию Арванд, так как на руках не имеет достаточно денежных средств.   Он очень надеется, что ему помогут в Арванде и поддержат в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Abdukudus is a man of 49. He is a punctual and very active person. He is married with four children. The older sons help him in his business. His wife works at home, taking care of the younger children. They have a large and happy family. Previously, they lived in the village, but when the kids were grown, they bought a house in the city and relocated. In the city, Abdukudus began his own business. He has a small stall in the local market. He trades food products (candy, biscuits, sweets). Abdukudus really likes this type of work because from it he receives a good income.
 
At the moment, he wants to expand his activities and to buy an assortment of different sweets. Abdukudus decided to apply for a loan and approached Arvand, because he doesn't have enough cash on hand. He very much hopes that Arvand will help and support him in difficult times.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru: Дилшода целеустремленная женщина, проживающая в районе Шахритус. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем, имеет двоих дочерей и одного сына. Дилшода хотела бы начать торговую деятельность. Она на рынке района имеет точку продажи размером 2х2 метра. Дилшода планирует заняться куплей и продажей овощей, в частности картофеля и лука. Она имеет стартовый капитал в размере 1000 TJS. До этого Дилшода занималась животноводством, и она отдала свой скот пастуху, чтобы полностью заняться новым бизнесом. Дилшода просит кредит для закупа картофеля и лука. Она будет закупать товар оптом у дехкан близлежащих деревней и продавать в по розничной цене на местном рынке района.
texts.en:
Dilshoda is a purposeful woman who lives in the area of Shahrituz. She is 38 years old. She is married, and has two daughters and a son. Dilshoda would like to start trade activities. In the market, she has a 2x2 meter stall. Dilshoda plans to buy and sell vegetables, especially potatoes and onions. She has starting capital of 1,000 TJS. Before this, Dilshoda was involved in raising livestock, and she handed her livestock to a shepherd in order to start a completely new business. 

Dilshoda is asking for a loan to buy potatoes and onions. She will buy goods in bulk from the group farms in the nearby countryside and sell at a retail price in the local market area.

loans.use: to buy and sell potatoes and onions

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона жительница района Носири Хусрав. Она замужняя женщина в возрасте 27 лет, имеет одного сына. В данное время Фарзона живет с родителями, поскольку муж несколько лет тому назад уехал на заработки в другую страну, но так и не вернулся. Фарзона с поддержкой родителей одна без мужа растит сына. Для того, чтобы не быть обузой своим родителям, а наоборот стать независимой женщиной Фарзона решила заняться собственным делом. Она выбрала животноводческий бизнес. При дворе их дома есть коровник. Фарзона планирует заниматься купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Ей в деятельности будут помогать отец и брат. Фарзона обратилась за кредитом для закупа скота. Она заранее выражает благодарность за поддержку.
texts.en: Farzona is an inhabitant of the Nosiri Khusrav region. She is a married woman of 27 years, and has one son. At the moment, Farzona lives with her parents, because her husband a few years ago went to work abroad and did not return. Farzona with the support of her parents is raising her son alone. In order not to be a burden on her parents, but rather to become an independent woman Farzona decided to engage in her own work. She chose the livestock business. Near their home is a barn. Farzona plans to buy and sell cattle. She will be assisted in this work by her father and brother. Farzona requested a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Danaya Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DANAYA IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Diassela, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KARIA la première  personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice 110 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Danaya IV group are married women who, on average, are 31 years old and have three children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Diassela, a village in the region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of Mali. They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities at the start of the rainy season.

They grow, among other things, ground nuts, millet, and beans. They are on their third loan with the institution. 

With this new loan, Karia, the first person seated on the left, plans to buy farm inputs, small pieces of equipment and to pay for the cost of labor to maintain about 2 hectares of millet and ground nuts. 

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the town of Beleco to customers who are men and women. Karia hopes to earn about 110,000 francs CFA per field.

loans.use: [to buy] seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small pieces of equipment [and to pay for] labor and weeding

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора 40-летняя замужняя женщина. Она проживает с мужем, сыном, дочерью и свекровью в районе Шахритус. За эти годы Нигора осознала, что единственный способ нормального существования ее семьи является открытие собственного дела. Нигора намерена заняться швейным производством, так как умеет хорошо шить. И к тому же услуги по пошиву, ремонту одежды и домашнего текстиля всегда пользуются хорошим спросом. Нигора будет принимать заказы у себя дома и на начальном этапе ее первыми клиентами будут родственники, друзья, знакомые. Чтобы реализовать свою цель она обратилась за кредитом для приобретения швейной машинки и тканей. Благодаря кредиту Нигора сможет начать дело и стать независимой и успешной женщиной.
texts.en:
Nigora is a 40-year-old, married woman. She resides with her husband, son, daughter and mother-in-law in the Shahrituz region. Over the years, Nigora realized that the only way for a normal existence for her family is to open their own business. Nigora intends to engage in sewing production since she knows how to sew well. And besides sewing services, clothing repair and household textiles are always in good demand. 

Nigora will be taking orders from her home and in the initial stages her first customers will be relatives, friends, and acquaintances. To realize her goal, she applied for a loan to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. Thanks to the loan, Nigora can start her activities and become an independent and successful woman.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric to open work

loans.name: Toshmamat

texts.ru: Тошмамат житель села Айвач Шахритусского района. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и отец двоих сыновей. Старший сын находится на заработках за пределами страны, а второй сын работает на стройке. Сам Тошмамат является опытным дехканином. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Его жена помогает ему в ведении сельского хозяйства и они вместе продвигают деятельность. Одновременно Тошмамат хочет начать бизнес откорм-продажа крупнорогатого скота. В их селе имеется хорошее пастбище для разведения скота. И к тому же Тошмамат имеет 0,5га посеянной пшеницы, солому которой вместе с жмыхом он будет использовать для корма скота. Таким образом он не будет покупать корм. Тошмамат берет кредит только для закупа коров и телят, чтобы приступить к делу.
texts.en:
Toshmamat is an inhabitant of the village Aivach in the Shahrituz region. He is 48 years old. He is married and the father of two sons. The elder son is working abroad, and the second son works in construction. Toshmamat himself is an experienced dekhan (group) farmer. He cultivates crops. His wife helps him in farming and together they promote the activity. 

At the same time, Toshmamat wants to start a business fattening and reselling cattle. In their village, there is a good pasture for livestock. And besides that, Toshmamat has 0.5 hectares sown with wheat straw which together with oil cake he will use to feed the livestock. In this way he will not need to buy food. Toshmamat is only taking a loan for the purchase of cows and calves to get down to business.

loans.use: to buy, fatten, and resell cattle

loans.name: Uheri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngalya est présidente  du groupe d’affaire « Uheri », doyenne du groupe,  entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 ont déjà leurs propres foyers et 3 sont étudiants. La cliente est vendeuse des poissons.  Elle commença cette activité avec le crédit de Hekima, il y a environs 8 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 panier de poissons. La guerre dans le territoire de Rutshuru, l’insécurité au long de la route vers la pêcherie de Vitshumbi sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Ngalya is the president of the business group Uheri. She is [also] the oldest member and a brave entrepreneur. Aged 51, she is a widow and a mother of six children, of whom three already have their own homes and three are students.

Ngalya sells fish. She started this business about eight years ago with a loan from Hekima. This new loan will serve to buy one basket of fish.

The war in the Rutshuru territory and the insecurity along the road towards the Vitshumbi fishery are major obstacles to the development of her business.

In the future, Ngalya wishes to expand her business, educate her children, and buy a piece of land. She thanks Hekima for their lending support to women entrepreneurs.

It should be noted that some of the group members are holding their babies [in the photo].

loans.use: to buy a basket of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Danaya V Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DANAYA V sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Diassela, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA ISSA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 90 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Danaya V group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have four children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Diassela, one of the villages in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities at the beginning of the rainy season.

They grow, among other things, ground nuts, millet, and beans. They are on their third loan with the institution.

With this new loan, Djeneba Issa, the person seated in the middle, plans to buy farm inputs and small pieces of equipment and to pay the costs of labor to maintain about one hectare of millet and groundnuts. 

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the town of Beleco to customers who are men and women.

Djeneba Issa hopes to earn 90,000 francs CFA per field.

loans.use: [to buy] seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small pieces of equipment [and to pay for] labor and weeding

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe has become the only bread-winner in his family after his father died and he does his best to provide minimum living conditions for his mother and school-aged sister. They own a plot of land, the harvest of which (tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots and greens) is very small and it is just enough for their family use. They also have a small farm; three cows, two bulls, three calves, ten sheep and eight lambs. 

Vahe is very young; he is 19, but already very skilled in farming and agriculture, of course with the help of his mother who helps him very much. Vahe’s family lives in the village Tsaghkunk in Sevan area. He also works at a gas station filling cars.

Vahe feels very responsible to take care of their farm and living conditions and he has decided to ask for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and animal fodder.

loans.use: To buy two cows and animal fodder

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
This is Jason. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he used to buy  additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jason hopes that his business will continue to grow and expand. He  meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week where he finds strength and encouragement from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita.  She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nenita dreams to expand her business and have more sources of income.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.*

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 60 years old, married with four children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eufemia has a welding shop business in the Philippines.  Eufemia requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like paint, welding rods, etc. and additional tools for her business.

Eufemia has been in this business for 48 years.  Eufemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like paint, welding rods, etc. and additional tools for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with 4 children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell to customers.
