Susan has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from raising duck.

Susan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family.  Lolita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fish to sell.  Lolita has been in this business for 50 years now.

In the future, Lolita  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Viladin

texts.en:
Viladin is 61 years old.  He lives in Kesalo village, Gardabani district with his 50 year old wife, 27 year old son and retired mother in-law.  Viladin requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success.  His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 milk cows.  The cows are milked everyday to produce dairy products.  The products are sold at the local markets and among the villagers.  The family has additional income from Viladin’s mother in-law’s monthly pension. 

Viladin requested loan from Credo to start up a family business.  Viladin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products.  These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Viladin will purchase a mini-bus.  Kesalo is a small village and the nearest market is in Gardabani district.  It’s hard for the local people to travel there to buy the daily products as there are not many transports going in that direction.  Viladin will drive the bus to transport his villagers to Gardabani center, where they can purchase all the needed products.  Viladin will start earning additional income for the family and also will help his villagers to have better access to the city.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Nemuta

texts.en:
Nemuta is 29 years, married to Kaiseiyye and supports a family of seven members.  She and her husband are farmers who grow different types of crops that include potatoes, wheat and barley for commercial use.

She learnt about KADET LTD from a friend of her husband, who is a registered member and already being funded by KADET LTD.  She has acquired her eighth loan of KES. 90,000 which will be used to meet the cost of hiring a tractor for land preparation, as well as purchase of pesticides.  She will use the proceeds to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to raise a well educated family and be an outstanding farmer in the region.

loans.use: to meet the cost of hiring a tractor for land preparation and to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a 46 years old living in Pangabuan, Tangub City with her three children.  She manages her owned farm planting and harvesting different types of crops.  Erlinda sells her products in the  fruit markets.  The income from her farm allows Erlinda to meet her big family's needs. 

She decided to enlarge her fruit garden and to establish a new banana farm in her plot of land.  For this purpose, she asks from GDMPC micro credit a loan of 30,000.00 PHP.  This deal will help Erlinda to have a new banana farm and after few years, she hopes to receive a good harvest from her farm

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Natampash

texts.en:
Natampash is fifty years old, married to Serina and supports a family of ten members.  He has been a barley farmer in Narok for the last ten years making a monthly income of KES. 25,000.

He learnt about KADET LTD from other farmers in the area.  This will be his seventh loan of KES. 90,000 to hire a tractor for spraying his farm as well as to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

He will use the proceeds to meet the family's basic needs.  His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for spraying his farm as well as to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 54, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines.  She is a mother to her four children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Josefina is a mineral water distributor.  What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sells them per container (5 gallons per container) for a profit.  Her regular customers of her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more containers of mineral water to expand her product inventory. 

Josefina hopes to have a store expansion and dreams to have a secure future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda.  She previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes to give a good future to her family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Cherry Ly

texts.en:
This is Cherry. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase ingredients and pay for the maintenance of the equipment of her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for ingredients and pay for the maintenance of the equipment of her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cherry dreams that her business will grow even more. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients and pay for the maintenance of the equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is 25 years old and comes from East Gem in Homabay county. She is married to Nyadongo who also supports the family by providing income. She  supports five people in her family; she has five children who are 14, 12, 10, four years old and the last-born is three months old.

She sells fish in her local market, a business she has been doing for the last two years, and generates a monthly income of KES. 15,000, she has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more fish for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to expand her business so as to employ other people to help her run the business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
This is Angeles, 36, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, a driver, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Angeles is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sell it per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory. 

Angeles hopes that her business will grow and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Rempesa

texts.en:
Rempesa is a humble gentleman, aged forty, married to Eunice, and he engages in poultry raising.  He has a family of ten dependents. 

Rempesa has been in the farming business for the last ten years making a monthly income of KES. 35,000. He has been advanced with an eighth loan of KES. 90,000 which will facilitate the purchase of fertilizer, pesticides and wheat seedlings.

He will use the proceeds to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to grow his business to a highly profitable venture and acquire his own machinery.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and  wheat seedlings.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work (farming) for four years.His primary income sources are milk and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is "dairy keeping" and his biggest challenge is "drought". Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Isaac was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "it is efficient".  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and he responded: "record keeping".
 
His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Isaac replied that "it will generate more income".

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Isaac owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile". Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD".

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 10 children and has been doing his work for 12 years.  His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Agri-business.' His biggest challenge is 'Lack of finances.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Weldon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because it helps us.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Good for farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Weldon replied, 'Generate income as it will enable me to expand my farming activities.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Weldon owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water, sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Don José de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de llantas desde hace varios años, tiene  mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio su producto, con la ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar llantas por mayor y seguir con su trabajo  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Don José is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He sells tires for a living and has for many years. He has many customers as he sells his product at a good price. With the income that he obtains from his sales he manages to cover the household expenses. Don José is requesting a loan to be able to buy tires wholesale and continue with his work that is his only source of employment and therefore be able to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tires wholesale.

loans.name: Adamasay

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Adamasay from the Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. 

She is married with three children between the ages of three and nine years. All of her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Adamasay established her food stand business. She began her business because she needed to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 7 days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Adamasay requires a loan in order to buy more cooking oil, onions and plastic buckets. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Adamasay plans to build a permanent residence for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, onions and plastic buckets.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth tiene 28 años, tiene tres  hijos de las edades de 10,7  años que se encuentran en edad escolar y una bebe de nueve meses,  ella se dedica a tejido de chompas,  mantas y ropa de bebe, en su domicilio que se encuentra en la  zona de  Villa Adela, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Ruth va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para remodelar un ambiente de su casita y también para la compra de lana por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta ya que hace mucho frio, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto,  la Sra. Ruth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Ruth is 28 years old and has three children, two in school at ages 10 and 7 and a baby of nine months. She makes a living from knitting sweaters, blankets and baby clothing in her home, which is in the Villa Adela area. 

This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Ruth is going to use this loan to buy construction material to remodel her house environment, and also to buy wool wholesale to knit her sweaters and blankets. This time of year she has a lot of sales, as it is very cold. She also delivers requests to the various markets of the city of El Alto. 

Ruth faces challenges in her business, such as stocking her merchandise, and she is going to utilize the benefits and keep buying her materials wholesale for the knitting of her clothing.

loans.use: to buy construction material and wool for knitting clothing

loans.name: Herine

texts.en:
Herine is a 61 year-old mother from Homabay town. She is a widow with six children who are now grown up and take care of themselves.

She sells second hand shoes a business she has been doing for the last four years which generates a monthly income of KES. 40,000.  She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more shoes and sandals to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to put back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable life with the help of the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Isatu from Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children aged 10 and 15 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2009, Isatu established her general stock business. She began her business because she needed to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 7 days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more variety of items including milk, toothpaste, and sardines. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more variety of items including milk, tooth paste, and sardines.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 67 years-old and widowed with three children. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Norma has been in this business for twelve years and she sells a variety of items including sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 23-year-old farmer from Aravus village. The village is located in one of the coldest regions of Armenia: Syuniq. Locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding.

Gevorg learned how to breed cattle when he was little boy, and now his livestock currently includes 30 goats, 8 cows and 10 calves.

As the family's only breadwinner, Gevorg works hard to cover basic costs. He lives with his parents, who are supplied with a retirement pension. Agriculture is the only source of Gevorg's income and it is very important for him.

By requesting this loan Gevorg would like to purchase 5 calves. Increasing his livestock will significantly increase the profit from business and Gevorg will have appropriate living conditions.

As a very hardworking young man, Gevorg does his best to have a big farm of his dreams and ensure a better life for his parents and future family.

loans.use: to pay for 5 calves.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Emma from Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. One of her children is currently attending school.  

Emma runs a general store within her community. She sells biscuits, pure water and soft drinks. She has been running this business for the past 22 years. She works at the business from every day, 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. She says that the main challenges to her are price inflation and insufficient capital to operate her business.

Emma has requested a loan in order to buy more sardines, biscuits, pure water and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to build a house and send her children to university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more sardines, biscuits, pure water and soft drinks.

loans.name: Raul Alfredo

texts.es: Don raul de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 9 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio y sus productos son frescos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don Raul esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar materiales como: laminas, polines, hierro y pago de mano de obra, para cambiar el techo de su vivienda porque ya esta muy dañado por tanto tiempo sin poder cambiarlo ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo y así  él su familia puedan vivir mas seguros en su hogar.
texts.en:
Raul is 52 years old and lives in a house he owns with his wife and their two children. He has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables for the last 9 years. His business is located in his home. He has a large clientele as he sells at a good price and his products are fresh. With his earnings he is able to cover some of his household expenses. 

Raul is asking for a loan to be able to buy materials like metal plates, beams and iron, and to pay for labor in order to put a new roof on his home. The roof he has is already very damaged after so much time without repair, as what he earns isn't enough to be able to fix it. This way his family will be able to live in their home more securely.

loans.use: to buy materials like metal plates, beams and iron, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Doña blanca de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 20 años su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol tambien tiene una pequeña tienda, con las ganancias que obtiene  logra solventar los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le presentan, doña blanca está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar laminas y cuartones(madera)  para poder hacer un cuarto ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo y asi puedan vivir mejor y mas cómodos con su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 47 years old and lives in the house she owns with her family.  She has worked as a farmer for 20 years.  Her main crops are corn and beans.  She also has a small store.  With the income she earns, she is able to meet the household expenses and other necessities.  

Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase zinc sheeting and wood beams to build a room since it is not possible to do with what she earns and this will allow her family to live better and more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting and wood beams.

loans.name: Gbolu

texts.en:
Please meet 55-year-old Gbolu, She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. This area one of the most populated areas in Montserrado county with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.

She completed 12 grades in school and is married. She has four children between the ages of 2 and 19. Only three are in school and they all live at home. 
Gbolu has owned a shop selling soap, milk, toothpaste, oil, rice and other items for the past five years. She will use this loan to purchase inventories such as soap, milk, toothpaste, oil, and rice. 

On average, she works 10 hours at her business. She started her business with money from her father. She transports her goods by bus. She cites a low number of goods in her shop as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers, since she is the only one who owns a general shop in her community. In the future, she would like to build a house and open another shop.  

She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as soap, milk, toothpaste, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
This is Fhevie. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Fhevie hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She attends the weekly fellowship* meetings that allow her to devote a few minutes of her time to studying and sharing God’s word. She values what is being shared and discussed in their weekly fellowship meetings. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Sarah from Kambia Northern area. She is single with four children between the ages of 5 and 17 years. Three of her children attend school. 

Sarah runs a street hawker business; she sells bread within the community. She has been running this business for six years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week.   Sarah says that the main challenge for her is insufficient capital to run the business.

Sarah has requested a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a big bread shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Khory Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHORY”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidneta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de llantas, venta de materiales escolares, transportista, venta de verduras, venta de regalos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace siete ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de útiles escolares; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace ocho años, observado la necesidad de las familias aledañas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación de herramientas (compra de útiles escolares) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
Khory Communal Bank will start its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Regional Office.  It's made up of 10 members governed by a board of directors of which Elena's the president.  The various businesses of the communal bank members include food sales, tire sales, school supplies sales, transportation, vegetable sales, and gift sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Elena.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven loan cycles, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling school supplies.  She says she started this business eight years ago, seeing the need of village families.
 
The loan she'll get now is to update her implements by buying school supplies, which she'll get from the markets in the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the trainings and the loans.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. Her previous loan helped her not just in her business but even in her household expenditures. Her loan also helped in her children's education. She has been in this business for six years now. She and her husband are working to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita dreams that her junk shop will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish their studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She attends the fellowship* every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle to help him in his transportation business.

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, etc. desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues da sus productos a buen precio y  son de muy buena calidad, flor esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por  mayor para seguir con su negocio y poder seguir ayudando a su familia en lo que necesiten sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
34-year-old Flor lives in her own house with her husband and her three children.  For several years she has made a living selling perfume, lotions, deodorant, etc.  Her business is located in where she lives.  She has many customers because her products have good prices and are of good quality. 

Flor is asking for a loan so that she can buy her merchandise at wholesale, in order to continue with her business and to continue helping her family with what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, and deodorants at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el ajonjolí, vende sus productos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus cosechas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposas y sus tres hijos,  juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas,  abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, veneno para plaga, etc. para poder seguir con sus cosechas y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan, 35 years old, has been a farmer for several years. His principal crops are corn and sesame. He sells his products to basic grains agencies near his residence. With the profits he obtains from his harvests he is able to cover some of his household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and three children.

Juan is applying for a loan in order to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, herbicide and poisons to prevent infestations, etc. Thus he can continue with his crops and will be able to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, herbicides and poisons to prevent infestations.

loans.name: Dankay

texts.en:
Dankay is 25 years-old and single with two children, aged two and seven years. She runs a food stand business in Lunsar in the Northern area of Sierra Leone. She began her business because she needed to create an income in order to be independent.

She’s been in this business for ten years and sells battery and paste, milk and sugar. Dankay says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Dankay requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy cigarettes, milk and sugar.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house and open a savings account. In the future, she would like to build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 37 years-old and lives in Kakata the capital city of Margibi County which is the highest producer of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married with four children between 19 to 6 years old and only three live at home and are in school.  For the past ten years, she has been selling salt, vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions in the local market.  She started this business by selling for her mother and learned this trade from her friends. She spends nine hours a day on her business.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil,  soap, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: emmanuel est homme agé 46 ans divorcé, père de 03 enfants scolarisés dont l'âge varie entre 07 et 16 ans. il est commerçant dans un marché de la capitale depuis deux ans. il fait dans la vente des vêtements sportifs , son activité fonctionne à merveille, il a juste un problème dû à la petitesse de son capital qui l'empêche de diversifier sa marchandise et l'oblige aà acheter en petite quantité. il a besoin de ce crédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandise tout en la diversifiant. Ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is 46 years old, divorced, the father of three children enrolled in school, whose ages vary from seven to 16 years. He has been a shopkeeper in a market in the capital for two years. He sells sports clothing, and his business is going really well. His only problem is that his working capital is so small which prevents him from diversifying his merchandise and forces him to buy in small quantities. 

Emmanuel needs this loan to grow his inventory and, at the same time, diversify it. This will increase his sales as well as his profit margin. Part of his profit will be reinvested in his business to expand it and the rest will help him to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to grow his inventory and diversify it.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, su principal siembra es maíz y el frijol con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, doña maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para su siembra como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía, para seguir con sus y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
55-year-old Maria has made a living in agriculture for 20 years.  Her main crops are corn and beans.  With the earnings she makes, she manages to cover the expenses of her home.  She lives in her own house with her four children and her husband.  

Doña Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies like manure, fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, etc. (as the photo shows) for her crops, so that she can continue with her business and be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, weed-killer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con sus padres, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo sus productos los comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que tiene en su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno donde desea sembrar para poder obtener mejores ganancias para seguir ayudando en su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client lives in his own house with his parents. He has been farming for several years and his main crops are corn and sorghum. He sells his crops in the various markets near his home. With the earnings he gets he helps with the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy manures, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc.,  and improve the land where he wishes to plant so that he can get better earnings and continue helping in his home as much as possible.

loans.use: To buy manures, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.es: Doña arcadia de 60 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa  para damas y caballeros desde hace varios  años,  cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote. Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive con su madre en casa propia,  doña arcadia  solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa  ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su madre.
texts.en:
Arcadia is 60 years old and has been selling women's and men's clothing for several years. She has many steady customers which enables her to keep her business afloat. With the earnings she gets from her sales, she is managing to cover some of her household expenses.  She lives with her mother in her own home. 

Arcadia is requesting a loan, by means of which she will be able to buy a greater quantity of clothing, as she has a great demand from many people. This way she will be able to acquire clothing of different prices, styles and colors, and this way have more customers and improve her quality of life and that of her mother.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of clothing.

loans.name: Vanik

texts.en:
Vanik and his elder son are engaged in agriculture and farming and year by year it is obvious that hard working and contentious investments bring good profit. In their farm they keep two cows, one bull, two calves and seven beehives. They also have a piece of private land on which they have several apple trees and they also cultivate potatoes.  

Vanik and his family lives in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik Province. Vanik has a wife and two sons and the younger son is a student. Vanik has worked in different places and he has done different work but small salary for a great deal of time have made Vanik fully engaged in farming.

Vanik is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to purchase two cows and animal fodder. Vanik has already taken loans from Nor Horizon three times and he has never been late paying back.

loans.use: to buy two cows and animal fodder.

loans.name: Marima

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mariama from the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. 

She is married with four children between the ages of seven years and 22 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2009, Mariama established her bar and restaurant business. She began her business because she needed to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business seven days per week and for 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy greater variety of soft drinks, start beer, stout, and snacks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family.  

In the future, Mariama plans to build a permanent residence for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of soft drinks, start beer, stout, and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow her stock of fish.

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 29 лет, проживает в городе Душанбе. В данный момент Рухсора не работает, однако она умеет шить женские национальные платья. Теперь она хотела бы использовать свое умение на профессиональном поприще и открыть собственное швейное дело, который имеет хороший спрос. В начале бизнеса ее первыми клиентами будут близкие, знакомые, соседи. Она планирует в день вышивать одно простое платье и одно платье с вышивкой. Рухсора будет принимать заказы у себя дома. Чтобы осуществить свою цель, Рухсора запрашивает кредит. На сумму кредита она хочет приобрести швейную машину и ткани для шитья. Открыв собственное дело Рухсора смогла бы улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Rukhsora is a young, married woman of the age of 29. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. 

Currently Rukhsora does not work, however, she knows how to sew women's national dresses. Now she would like to use her knowledge in the professional arena, and open her own sewing business, which is in high demand. In the beginning her first customers will be relatives, acquaintances and neighbors. She plans to sew one simple dress and one with embroidery per day. Rukhsora will take orders at her home. 

In order to realize her goal, Rukhsora requests a loan. For the loan amount, she would like to purchase a sewing machine and fabric for sewing. After having started her own business, Rukhsora will be able to improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric for sewing

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila tiene 51 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, su hijo y su nuera. Dalila se dedica a la venta de pollos, pero hace tres meses decidió emprender un nuevo negocio dedicado a la venta de comida porque siempre está buscando maneras de incrementar sus ingresos. En las mañanas acompaña a su esposo al mercado para ayudarlo con la venta de pollos y luego regresa a su hogar para la preparación de comidas y venderlas en la ciudad. Siempre tuvo la idea de poner un negocio dedicado a la venta de comida y gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene una mejor calidad de vida. Para Dalila este es su primer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido y promete puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
El monto de S/.2000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de las comidas y la compra de pollos.
texts.en:
Dalila is 51 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Dalila makes a living selling chickens, however three months ago she decided to start a new business selling cooked food because she is always looking for ways to increase her earnings. During the mornings, she accompanies her husband to the market where she helps him sell chickens and then she returns home to prepare meals to sell in the city. She always had the idea of establishing a business selling meals and thanks to her family’s support, she was able to move ahead and now has a better quality of life.

This is Dalila’s first loan from Kiva and she is very grateful for the economic support she has received and promises to be punctual with her repayments. She will use the sum of S/. 2,000 to buy ingredients to prepare meals and to buy chickens.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 52 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. Francisca es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, helados, gelatinas, etc. Hace 3 años como una actividad complementaria se dedica a la crianza de pollos para luego venderlos. En su casa tiene un pequeño corral donde cría a sus pollos con su esposo. La crianza de pollos le ayudo a salir adelante y mejorar su negocio y percibir nuevos ingresos y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Esta es la primera vez que Francisca obtiene un crédito con Kiva, por lo que está muy emocionada y agradece el apoyo económico recibido.
El monto de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is 52 and lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. Francisca is a very hard-working woman who sells soft drinks, ice cream, gelatins, etc. Three years ago, as a complementary activity, she began selling chickens for subsequent sale. In her home she has a small pen where she and her husband raise their chickens. Raising chickens has helped her to move forward and improve her business, earn new income, and this way improve her quality of life and that of her family.

This is the first time that Francisca is getting a loan with Kiva, so she is very excited, and grateful for the financial support received.  She will use the amount of 1500 soles to purchase chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens for improving her business.

loans.name: Toir

texts.ru: Тоир 20-летний молодой человек. Он холост и живет с родителями, сестрой и братом в городе Душанбе. Тоир является скотоводом. Он помогает своему дяде в разведении скота. И к тому же у Тоира имеется одна дойная корова с теленком, за которым присматривает он сам. Каждое утро его мать доит корову и полученный 5 литр молока продает своим клиентам. Сейчас Тоир хочет начать свой животноводческий бизнес, так как приобрел в этом деле достаточный опыт. Он намерен закупать каждый месяц по трех голов крупного рогатого скота, и после откорма продавать на местном рынке с хорошей наценкой. Тоир имеет стартовый капитал в размере около 7000 TJS. Тем не менее он нуждается в кредите. Тоир на сумму кредита и сбережения хочет приобрести трех голов бычков и их корма, а также расширить коровник и провести там ремонтные работы. Он будет очень признателен за поддержку. Благодаря кредиту он наконец-то будет иметь свой собственный бизнес и развивать его в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Toir is a 20 years old young man. He is single and lives with his parents, sister and brother in the city of Dushanbe. Toir is a herdsman. He helps his father with breeding cattle. He also has a dairy cow with a calf, which he looks after himself. Every morning his mother milks the cow, and sells the five liters of milk to her customers. 

Currently, Toir would like to start his own livestock breeding business, as he has now acquired sufficient experience in this business. He intends to purchase around three heads of cattle per month, and after having fattened them, sell them at the local market with a good profit. 

Toir has a starting capital of the amount of around 7,000 somoni (TJS). Nonetheless, he needs to take a loan. For the loan amount and the savings, Toir would like to purchase three bulls and their fodder, and also expand the cowshed and carry out repair work there. He will appreciate the support very much. Thanks to the loan he will finally have his own business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three bulls and their fodder to start a business of fattening and reselling cattle

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
In 2010 Marieta opened her general store, which is located in one of the city's markets. Over time, Marieta has become famous in her area for providing good quality products. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

Marieta lives with her husband and son who help her in running the shop. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies that will allow her to meet client demand and stay competitive in the market. Because her store is the family's sole financial source, the loan is very important for Marieta.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for the shop

loans.name: Kuldar

texts.ru:
Кулдар  53 года, имеет 4 детей. Кулдар в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур – фасоли, перца, пшеницы, стартовав свой бизнес с покупки 2 голов коров. Благодаря упорному труду Кулдар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 15 голов мелкого скота, 1,80 га арендованной земли. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит в месяц около(KGS) 8,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулдар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 бычков.  Доходы от кредита Кулдар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины,  а также  накопить на  будущую свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Kuldar is 53 years old and has four children. To get income for her family, Kuldar works with livestock breeding and growing of agricultural crops - beans, peppers and wheat. She started this business with the purchase of two cows. Thanks to persistent work, Kuldar currently has two heads of cattle with offspring, 15 sheep and goats and 1.80 hectares of rented land on her farm. The sale of milk and dairy products brings in around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kuldar turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase the number of cattle through purchasing two bulls. Kuldar plans to invest the income form the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and also to save money for her future wedding of her son.

loans.use: to purchase two bull-calves

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo de 34 años de edad se dedica a la producción de queso y quesadillas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Reynaldo está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar botellas con leche por mayor, harina, azúcar, etc.  para poder producir más queso y quesadillas pues ese su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
34-year-old Reynaldo has made a living by producing cheese and quesadillas for several years.  The business he has is located in his home.  With the earnings he gets, he manages to cover the household expenses.  

Reynaldo is asking for a loan so that he can buy bottles of milk, flour, sugar, etc. at wholesale so that he can produce more cheese and quesadillas, since this is his only source of work.  This way he can give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy bottles of milk, flour, sugar, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! Mariatu, 25, is from the Lunsar northern area. She is single and has three children between the ages of 2 and 6. She started her business because she did not go to school and needed to earn income to support her household. 

Mariatu runs a used clothing business. She sells shirts and ladies blouses. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. The main challenge for her business is transportation.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase used shirts and blouses. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her stock. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase used shirts and blouses

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru:
Адиба  жизнерадостная молодая женщина  в возрасте 25 лет. Замужем имеет одного ребёнка и живут они с мужем счастливо.  Муж её работает в центральной больнице района, бухгалтером и получает небольшую заработную плату. Сама   Адиба  занимается откармливанием скота.   В наличии имеет 2 голов рогатого скота.   Дополнительно они имеют около дома небольшую лавку где там она сама продает продукты питания и получает не большой  доход от этого. Основной доход  у нее от откармливание и продажи скота .
 Адиба с мужем мечтают построить дом и создать уют и комфорт своему ребенку. Поэтому она старается развивать свой бизнес по откорму скота и получать прибыль и на накопленные денежные средства начать строить дом.  Адиба обратилась в организацию Арванд за кредитом, она очень надеется что ей в Арванде помогут и она реализует свои будущие планы.
texts.en:
Adiba is a cheerful young woman of the age of 25. She is married and has one child, and lives happily together with her husband. Her husband works at the central hospital of the region as an accountant, and receives a small salary for this. 

Adiba works with fattening cattle. She currently has two heads of cattle. In addition they have a small store next to their home, where Adiba sells food products. She gets a small income from this. Her main income is from fattening and reselling cattle. 

Adiba and her husband dream of building a house and make it cozy and comfortable for their child. Therefore she tries to develop her business of fattening cattle, receive an income and for the money saved start building a house. Adiba turned to the organization "Arvand" for a loan. She hopes very much that "Arvand" can help her and that she can realize her future plans.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 44 años de edad, esta casada con José quien es comerciante. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 04 hijos de 21, 18, 13 y 7 años de edad respectivamente. La a actividad que realiza Lili es la venta de productos comestibles, para eso cuenta con una tienda que instaló en su vivienda, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son su vecinos. Se inició hace más de 05 años con los ahorros que tenia pero actualmente considera a su negocio bastante rentable pues sus productos son muy rentables. Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas, pero si los deseos de generase sus propios ingresos y apoyara a su padres con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio e incursionar en otro negocio de venta de ropas, pues ha visto que es bastante rentable. Por tanto éste será su séptimo préstamo con Kiva. Está contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar , leche , entre otros,  para así surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Lili, 44 years old, is married to José, who is a trader. She lives with her husband and her four children, who are 21, 18, 13 and 7 years of age, respectively. Lili devotes herself to selling food products. She has a store that she established in her home where she graciously assists customers who are mainly her neighbors. She started more than five years ago with savings she had but now she considers her business to be very profitable since her products are very cost-effective.

Lili started her business, not because she had problems, but rather because she wanted to generate her own earnings and help her parents with household expenses. Consequently, upon seeing the good results that she is having, she wants to continue with her business and venture into another business selling clothing, since she has seen that it is also very profitable. Therefore, this will be her seventh loan from Kiva. She is happy knowing she will be able to rely on financial support in order to proceed with her business. With the sum of S/. 1,000 requested, she will purchase food products, such as rice, sugar and milk, among other items, in order to stock her grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase food products, such as rice, sugar and milk, among other items.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 30 años, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años con quien vive en la casa de sus padres.
Margarita se dedica a alquiler un mototaxi, para esto compró un vehículo de segundo uso y a bajo costo. Además, gracias al optimismo que siempre demostró y a su afán por superarse día a día pudo comprarse hace algunos años un taxi que también alquila como vehículo de servicio de transporte público por las principales calles de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad 3 años y gracias a este trabajo su economía ha mejorado y  ha podido solucionar algunas carencias que antes existía en su hogar.Este es su noveno crédito con Kiva y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles comprará algunos repuestos y mandará sus vehículos al taller automotriz para su revisión y refacción general.
texts.en:
Margarita, 30, is married and has a two-year-old son who she lives with in her parents' house. Margarita makes a living renting out a mototaxi, which is why she bought a low-cost second-hand vehicle.

Furthermore, thanks to the optimism she has always shown and her toiling day-to-day to get ahead, she was able to buy a taxi a few years ago that she also rents out as a public transport service vehicle throughout the principal streets of the city. She has been doing this for three years and thanks to this work, her economic status has improved and she has been able to overcome some of the shortcomings her household was experiencing before.

This is her ninth loan with Kiva and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, since this way she feels more secure moving forward with her work. She also commits to making her payments on time. With the 2500 soles requested, she will buy some parts and will send her vehicles to the automotive workshop for general review and renovation.

loans.use: to buy parts and maintenance for her vehicles

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 44 years old and lives in Ddmashen Village in the Gegharkunik region. She lives with her husband and two sons. They have a nice family and help each other on the farm since they know that working together ensures that they will earn a decent income. 

Anna very recently repaid her first Kiva loan. The loan was very successful and she is again requesting your help and support to enlarge her farm by purchasing cattle and potato seedlings. 

Anna’s farm is not very large. She has one cow, five pigs, and ten chickens. She wants to buy an additional cow and ten piglets. Anna’s agricultural activities also need improvement. Last season’s perfect potato harvest has made Anna eager to continue potato cultivation.

Anna needs 600,000 Armenian drams in order to make her purchases. She is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a cow, ten piglets, and potato seedlings

loans.name: Griselda Isabel

texts.es: Griselda de 39 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida.  Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; griselda es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Griselda  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Griselda is 39 years old and lives with her life partner.  She has a tortilla shop that is well known in the town where she lives.  She has many customers because she sells the best tortillas; they are warm and she has the fastest service, in addition to very affordable prices.  Griselda is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead in life.  She has the attitude of a winner, and because of this she always stays ahead of the competition.  

She thinks that when someone wants something they should know that there are risks and that is why life is worthwhile.  She wants to take the risk in order to make her business grow, which is why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale corn.  Griselda has hope that this way she will be able to bring financial stability to her home and a full life to her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial en su trato a los demás. Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijo de tres años de edad en su casa propia. María se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. Para esto cuenta con un puesto en el mercado cerca a su hogar, en donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ganándose así su preferencia. 
Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio y preparando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo la acogida que tenía su negocio decidió continuar , actualmente  cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá, compartiendo con ella sus ganancias. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que  siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender, dejándole muy buenas ganancias. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva y está contenta por el apoyo financiero qye recibe para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprara utensilios para cocina como ollas, platos, vasos y otros.
texts.en:
María, 43, is a hard-working and earnest woman, and she is also friendly and cordial in the way she treats others. She lives with her husband and their three-year-old child in their own home. 

María makes a living selling regional food dishes. For this, she has a stand in a market near her home where she attends to clients in a friendly and cordial manner, earning their preference.

She started more than ten years ago, using her own capital to prepare small quantities. Seeing the reception that her business had, she decided to continue. She currently has the support of her mother, and shares her earnings with her. She considers her business quite profitable since she always runs out of everything she makes to sell, which leaves behind very good earnings. 

This will be her third loan with Kiva and she is happy for the financial support that she receives in order to keep moving forward, which is why she is committed to making her payments on time. With the 1000 nuevos soles requested, she will buy kitchenware such as pots, plates, glasses, and more.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware such as pots, plates, glasses, and more

loans.name: Evelynline

texts.en:
Evelynline lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County that is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is  29 years old. She and her fiancee are living together, along with their two children, aged 6 and 4 years old. She completed grade 12 before starting her business. Her children are in school. 

For the past five years, she has been selling paracetamol, quinine, cough syrup, etc., in her community. She started this business with help from her parent and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, cough syrup, etc., for her business. She enjoys her business because of the profit she makes every day. Her plans are to build a modern pharmacy and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, cough syrup, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 39 years old; he is engaged in farming and agriculture and simultaneously works at the gas station as a gas loader of cars. Since he has shift work, he perfectly manages both his work and farming. He keeps three cows, three heifers and 33 chickens. 

Armen lives with his family in the village Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik area. His family is not very big: his wife and two school-aged children. His wife has a specialty in nursing, but she doesn't work now and she greatly helps Armen around their farm.

Armen asks for a loan of 620,000 Armenian drams to enlarge the number of his farm animals; he wants to buy two cows, chickens and sheep.

loans.use: To buy two cows, chickens and sheep.

loans.name: Tavakkul

texts.en:
Tavakkul is a farmer with 17 years of experience. He is engaged in farming and animal husbandry. His family's only income is from the sale of dairy products and greens. His family -- his wife and 24-year-old son -- closely participate in this activity.

Today, the lack of quality medicines for animals and fertilizer for the land creates difficulties in his work. To see the result of the treatment of animals, Tavakkul requires the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat)  for the purchase of quality medicines.

loans.use: To purchase quality medicines for the animals.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором молодая женщина в возрасте 33 лет. Родилась и выросла в городе Исфаре. Разведена и имеет дочку. Она еще совсем маленькая, и ходит в детский сад. Сама Дилором живет с родителями. У них большая семья. И у каждого отдельное хозяйство. Поэтому ей приходится  самой зарабатывает на жизнь.   Дилором, после того как муж ее оставил, начала искать работу.  Устроилась в одном маленьком магазине продавщицей.  Со временем,когда она научилась сама торговаться, начала свой бизнес.  
Дилором с города Худжанда покупает морепродукты(рыба), а в Исфаре в местных кишлаках продает их.  Развивая свой бизнес она открыла свой собственный ларек по продаже морепродуктов . У нее хороший доход. 
 Сейчас сезон, и оборот ее товара ускорилось , ей необходимо определенная сумма для за купа морепродуктов.  Она обратилась в Арванд за помощью.   Дилором узнала про Арванд, от соседей по бизнесу.  Она надеется на помощь и поддержку, и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a young woman of the age of 33 years. She was born and grew up in the city of Isfara. She is divorced and has one daughter. The daughter is still young and goes to kinder-garden. Dilorom lives together with her parents. They are a large family, and each one has their own business. Therefore she has to make a living for herself. 

After her husband left her, Dilorom started looking for work. She got a job as a saleswoman in a small store. Over time, when she had learned to do trade, she started her own business. Dilorom purchases seafood (fish) in the city of Khujand and sells it in the local quarters of Isfara. Having developed her business, she opened her own small store for selling seafood. She has a good income. 

Currently it's the season for seafood, and the turnover of her goods has accelerated. She needs a certain amount for purchasing seafood. She turned to "Arvand" for help. Dilorom was told about "Arvand" by a business neighbor. She hopes for help and support, and sends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to purchase seafood for selling

loans.name: Marubeni

texts.es:
Marubeni, de 38 años de edad, esta casada con Digno y tiene 02  hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Marubeni es la venta de comidas regionales. Todos las tardes instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa y pone a las venta sus platos de comida , los cuales son muy solicitados por los pobladores de su localidad.Se inició hace más de 08 años en está actividad y actualmente su negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias. Además comenta que le gusta está actividad pues conoce mucho  de cocina. Este será su séptimo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para salir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.600 nuevo soles comprará ingredientes tales como arroz , carnes , verduras , entre otros.
texts.en:
Marubeni, 38, is married to Digno and has two children, ages 12 and 10. They live comfortably together in their own house. Marubeni's business is to sell regional food dishes. Every afternoon she puts up a table in front of her house and starts selling her plates, which are in high demand among the residents of her town.

She began doing this work more than eight years ago, and her business is currently making very good earnings. She also likes this work because she knows a lot about cooking. 

This will be her seventh loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support received in order to help her get ahead, which is why she is committed to making her payments on time. With the 600 nuevos soles requested, she will buy ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables, and more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Alma  Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña alma de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. doña alma tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma, 57, lives in her own house with her husband.  She has a store where she sells necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and others.  She has had her business for a long time and it has given her sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits.

The store's located in her house in a busy area.  She has acquired a lot of customers because she has the best-stocked store.  People prefer her store and keep it ahead of the competition because she always has what they need: quality products at affordable prices and excellent customers service.

Like any good merchant she wants to grow her business and make a new investment.  She needs capital, however, so she's requesting a loan from Integral to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.

Alma has a good payment record and is certain she'll repay the debt.  She also trusts she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es: Pedro de 30 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y el locoro, cuando ya ha pasado la temporada de siembra se dedica a trabajar de jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con el pago de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa, pedro esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para su siembra como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y poder seguir con sus siembras para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su esposa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30 years old. He makes a living growing corn and locoro (a vine with edible flowers often used in pupusas). When the planting season has passed, he also works as a day laborer on a farm near his house. With his earnings from these two jobs, Pedro is able to pay his household expenses. He lives in a house he owns with his wife.

Pedro is requesting a loan in order to buy some necessary supplies for his crops such as compost, fertilizers, seeds, weedkiller, etc. in order to maintain his crops and stabilize his family's finances.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, weedkillers, etc.

loans.name: Albert Norberto

texts.es: Albert de 36 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y sorgo, vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Albert esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes y poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía,  para poder seguir con sus cosechas y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Albert, 36, has made a living in agriculture for several years.  He grows corn and sorghum and sells his crops in the markets near his house.  With his profits he's able to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and his three children.

Albert's requesting a loan to be able to buy seed, soil amendments, herbicide, and fertilizer to improve the plot of land he farms, which is shown in the photograph.

This way he can continue with his harvests and give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seed, soil amendments, herbicide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a solventar los gastos de su casa vive con su padre en casa de él,  la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá ayudando a su padre en los gastos de la casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client makes a living selling all types of personal care products such as lotion, deodorant, perfume, cream, and other things.  Her business is located in her house.  With the profits from her sales she helps pay for the household expenses.  She lives with her father in his house.

The client wants to grow her business, so she's requesting a loan to be able to buy everything she needs: perfume, deodorant, lotion, and cream.  She's also going to buy clothing because she has a lot of customers because of her affordable prices.

With the requested help she'll be able to earn better profits and continue helping her father with the household expenses without any limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy personal care products and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! Ola, 46, is from the Lunsar northern area. She is married and has 4 children. Three of her children attend school. 

Ola runs a clothing business selling cloth and lace. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 13 hours per day, 7 days per week. The main challenge for her business is transportation.

Ola has requested a loan in order to buy more cloth and lace. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her stock. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cloth and lace

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 10 years; they all live at home and are in school. She was unfortunate to not attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a house builder. 

For the past three years, she has been running a cook shop, selling rice and soup in the local market. Now she faces no problems; she sells every day and spends 12 hours with her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, fish, meat, Vita seasoning, etc., for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, fish, meat, Vita seasoning, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 28 años de edad, está casada y es madre de un niño de 07 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven en su casa propia. María se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias, de manera quincenal o mensual, dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos.
